member_organisations: ITI has direct link with more than 180 companies (https://www.iti.es/asociados/nuestros-asociados/), coming mainly from the ICT sector and other industrial sectors with intensive use of ICT. In addition, ITI has close relationships with every relevant actor in ICT sector in Valencian Region, like ICT companies, associations (AVINFO, AVALNET, ...), Universities and other Public Research bodies.
fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Energy, Business and Industry, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Transport
head_office_address: Ciudad Politécnica de la Innovación, UPV Edificio 8G, Acceso B, 4ª planta Camino de Vera s/n

goals__remit:
In a world where digital technologies are drastically changing the way we design, produce, commercialize and consume all kinds of goods and services, the market requires Competence Centres that respond to present technological needs and, at the same time, are prepared to generate solutions for future needs. 
Instituto Tecnológico de Informática (ITI), as a Spanish Private Research & Technology Organization, is a Competence Centre in Information and Communication Technologies (ICT), established in 1994 by a joint initiative of the Polytechnic University of Valencia (UPV), the Valencian Institute of Business Competitiveness (IVACE), and a group of companies in the ICT sector.  
 
ITI’s mission is the generation of knowledge and development and integration of technologies and methods in the ICT field, enabling the composition of innovative, efficient, secure and accessible solutions to address societal and economic challenges, contributing to the improvement of industrial competitiveness, and to create an integrated, sustainable and intelligent society.
relevant_communication:
ITI actively participates in several European Technology Platforms, PPPs and JTIs (NESSI, BDVA, ECSEL, AIOTI). 
In FP7, ITI partnered in 7 projects; in H2020 ITI participates in 8 projects, up to December 2017.
